So prior to receiving this I had pretty rough elbows in particular and my skin feels dry. As a busy mum of two I admit I sometimes neglect myself.. some of you may empathise! But this product trial gave me the perfect opportunity to reconnect with myself and have a bit of \u201Cme time\u201D. So for 3 days after my baths / shower I smothered myself with this. I must admit the first time I put this on I wasn\u2019t sure about the smell. It\u2019s not offensive it\u2019s like a cucumber smell (although it\u2019s aloe) but I tend to smell of perfumes all the time.. however by day 3 I actually liked the smell. Application: it went on nicely not too thick and soaked in pretty quickly it didn\u2019t feel sticky. I always have my morning wash by 07:30 but even in the evening before bedtime my skin is feeling noticibly softer and my rough elbows gone. Verdict: thumbs up. Yes I will be continuing to use this thank you for a fab product trial and for introducing me to Vaseline Aloe! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

review_title: Good if you have sensitive skin
review_text: This is a good deodorant if you have easily irritated skin. It's like Dove soap in that it doesn't seem to irritate or dry out skin. I've used Dove soaps for quite a long time and this is certainly something which they are good for, this seems to be as good as all of them. It's main selling point, beyond being an effective 24 hour deodorant, is that it is not prone to marking your clothes. It certainly seems to work as far as that goes too, though we haven't been able to test on every single colour. Good though. Recommended.

This cream is light, odourless and leaves the skin feeling genuinely smooth, supple and refreshed. I use it as part of my nightly routine - applying it when going to bed after washing and drying my face. It is light enough not to clog the pores or feel sticky on the face, and in the morning my face always feels smooth and replenished. I have also tried using this cream during the daytime and, while it has all the benefits described above, it\u2019s not long-lasting enough in terms of the hydration it gives, meaning you often feel the need to reapply after a few hours. All in all a great overnight moisturiser if you have sensitive skin - it\u2019s unscented and it\u2019s really gentle on sore patches. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

We all crave things that transport us back to more innocent times. For me Bovril is one of those things, from the gooey unctuousness of the tar black bovril overflowing from the spoon to the "ding ding ding" as I stir it in hot water to make it dissolve and the earthy, beefy smell with hints of celery and goodness knows what else. Sometimes you can get alcohol fatigue so Bovril is a great alternative to a nightcap or even mug of tea. I even go so far as to dissolve a pat of butter in it too for extra richness and within an hour I'm pretty much knocked out and sleep soundly until morning, warm and comforted. This pack will last me a long time I am sure, certainly 2 winters.

I usually buy organic cosmetics and wanted a natural product without the high price tag. I was delighted to find this! This shower cream is one of the few big brands which does not contain SLS, a harmful skin irritant added as a foaming agent to create a lather. It is silky smooth, thick and creamy, gentle on the skin, and rich enough to moisturise my dry mature skin. It has a gorgeous delicate fragrance and feels far more expensive than it is. Excellent value, especially for a product which contains no Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Sodium Lauryl Sulfate or Parabens.

The mayonnaise would get 5 stars from me for taste but the container is style over substance. The squeezy bottle is, in itself, a genius idea but thats where it stops. It is too tall for the size of cap making it top heavy and unstable. Every bottle Ive ever put in my fridge has tumbled out. The cap is made of brittle plastic so it shatters as it hits the kitchen floor. Its like Groundhog Day each time it happens! Then, as other reviewers have commented, its impossible to get all the product out of the bottle. Surely this container is crying out for a design overhaul?

The moisturiser applies well to the skin and sinks in quickly leaving my skin feeling refreshed and moisturised with no heaviness or stickiness. I had no reaction to this moisturiser at all. I have a combination skin and this moisturiser was ideal as it has no greasiness. After a few hours of wearing I find that my skin feels totally normal, there is no greasiness at all which I sometimes get with creamy moisturisers. Also I found that I could apply makeup easily within a short period of time as the moisturiser sunk into my skin easily. I have light wrinkles and although the moisturiser can not perform miracles it did prevent my skin from drying over the day from the effects of heating or the sun. So prior to receiving this I had pretty rough elbows in particular and my skin feels dry. As a busy mum of two I admit I sometimes neglect myself.. some of you may empathise! But this product trial gave me the perfect opportunity to reconnect with myself and have a bit of \u201Cme time\u201D. So for 3 days after my baths / shower I smothered myself with this. I must admit the first time I put this on I wasn't sure about the smell. It's not offensive it's like a cucumber smell (although it's aloe) but I tend to smell of perfumes all the time.. however by day 3 I actually liked the smell. Application: it went on nicely not too thick and soaked in pretty quickly it didn't feel sticky. I always have my morning wash by 07:30 but even in the evening before bedtime my skin is feeling noticibly softer and my rough elbows gone. Verdict: thumbs up. Yes I will be continuing to use this thank you for a fab product trial and for introducing me to Vaseline Aloe! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

review_title: have been using for years, works well on all my silk, wool and linen items
review_text: I have been using this for years and it works really well; it has not damaged any of my clothes. it has not left a residue on any of my clothes. it keeps my clothes in good condition and colour. it has not irritated my sensitive skin in any way. I have been using Persil silk and wool for years and it is really good. I only looked on Amazon as my supermarket had not had any for 3 weeks in a row, and realised it costs about the same here on Amazon Pantry. I wash my silk, wool and linen items on a silk wash ( on my washing machine that is a setting, but I think it comes to the following...30 degrees C, light action, very low spin cycle - very important not to hard spin wool or silk, ruins the fibres) I hang them up to dry. all of these items are either hand wash only or dry clean only items, and quite honestly I do not have the strength to hand wash or the wish to dry clean. This has worked well for me for 10+ years using this detergent.

Great product, I used this for the first time after a bath and shaving my legs. The lotion wasn't greasy and left my legs smelling and feeling Fab. I can't wait to take this on holiday with me and hydrate my skin after a day in the sun. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

review_title: Light, non greasy and super moisturising.
review_text: Winter is really taking its toll on my skin and this moisturiser has been wonderful. It soaks in fast, isn't greasy at all and has a really refreshing aloe scent as well. It does everything I need to and does it well. It's water based so probably not best for oily skin, but on my normal to dry it's doing great. I'm pretty sensitive too but this hasn't caused any problems. However, it also contains Palm Oil. Now, palm oil is a brilliant ingredient and does a lot of wonderful things. But at the moment, it's rarely ethically sourced and that's my only issue with this product. Unilever are a big big player and need to address this issue. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I have tried this product and was totally impressed with how soft it left my skin. Its refreshing to the touch as well as to smell. I suffer from dry skin and this has made such a difference. I will be using this product all the time from now on. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I tried the Simple hydrating cleansing wipes during the evening to remove my makeup and cleanoses the skin. I found the wipes very soft and easy to use the wipes are nothe too wet or rough with just enough product on them to remove stubborn make up and feel gentle at the same time. Ideal for when you need tone take off makeup in a hurry and handy for traveling. I would recommend for anyone that has sensitive or dry skin. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

The fragrance is quite subtle but is definitely recognisable as cedarwood which is quite popular in men’s bathing products.

review_title: Lovely ice cream with plenty of chocolate fish
review_text: I received a tub of this to try. We had it for dessert after Sunday lunch and one tub was sufficient for all 4 of us. The children both loved it of course (and gave it a million stars out of 5) and particularly enjoyed counting how many chocolate fish they found. I thought it was a really nice chocolate ice cream with plenty of chocolate fish - much more than I expected - but didnt really think there was a lot of caramel or marshmallow content, which was a shame. I would, however, buy this product again.
If you want a sweet rich chocolate ice cream, this will hit the spot.

As a regular user of a number of simple products, I was very impressed with there refreshing shower gel. I suffer with quite dry skin during the winter, and when using other brands of shower gel they can sometimes act harshly and leave my skin quite dry and flaky, especially on my face. However with this simple shower gel this is not the case. It does not irritate my skin in face it leaves my complexion looking clearer and my skin feeling soft. The size of the bottle is adequate for everyday use and regular use. And although the packaging is quite mild it does the job. I would definitely choose this shower gel out of the choice. A little bit goes a long way, and the product has a pleasent scent. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

review_title: Extremely good value Persil washing capsules
review_text: Some things in life are enjoyable to buy and some things plainly are not. No matter how pretty the product and how bright and bold the actual washing detergent is, it will always be a grudge purchase. No one likes to have dirty smelly clothes and wash powder / tablets / capsules are a necessity that makes a hole in everyone's weekly grocery budget that could be better spent on something interesting such as cakes or exotic vegetables that you have to look up how to cook. Along with Ariel, Fairy and Bold, Persil is one of the big brands that dominant the market for detergents. It is owned by global consumer products giant Unilever who are experts at branding and marketing. It is refreshing to see these capsules at such reasonable value., they work out 15p each which is an absolute bargain. Even the dodgy imitation ones you find in sub prime supermarkets are more than these, and the great thing about Persil is that you can guarantee that the product is going to be high quality. These capsules come in a rubbery gossamer coated casing containing a different brightly coloured gel like liquids in each of the four compartments. And very funky they look too with purple, green, white and grey swirls of gu. These things wash your clothes nicely too and have a pleasant smell without being too overbearing. I have no idea what happens to the plasticated casing on the outside of the capsule after you put in in the washing machine. Maybe it bio-de-grades, maybe it disappears by magic, this is one of lives great mysteries like the Great Sphinx at Giza, the Bermuda Triangle or the meaning of the Voynich Manuscript.
Please wash really well and there is no residue left in the drum. Washing comes out clean and smelling fresh.

Even the dodgy imitation ones you find in sub prime supermarkets are more than these, and the great thing about Persil is that you can guarantee that the product is going to be high quality. These capsules come in a rubbery gossamer coated casing containing a different brightly coloured gel like liquids in each of the four compartments. And very funky they look too with purple, green, white and grey swirls of gu. These things wash your clothes nicely too and have a pleasant smell without being too overbearing. I have no idea what happens to the plasticated casing on the outside of the capsule after you put in in the washing machine. Maybe it bio-de-grades, maybe it disappears by magic, this is one of lives great mysteries like the Great Sphinx at Giza, the Bermuda Triangle or the meaning of the Voynich Manuscript.
it clean well
Second time ordering these. Bargain pack means it works out the same per capsule as a shops own brand! Clean the clothes well. Will definitely reorder again

review_title: Extremely good value Persil washing capsules
review_text: Some things in life are enjoyable to buy and some things plainly are not. No matter how pretty the product and how bright and bold the actual washing detergent is, it will always be a grudge purchase. No one likes to have dirty smelly clothes and wash powder / tablets / capsules are a necessity that makes a hole in everyone's weekly grocery budget that could be better spent on something interesting such as cakes or exotic vegetables that you have to look up how to cook. Along with Ariel, Fairy and Bold, Persil is one of the big brands that dominant the market for detergents. It is owned by global consumer products giant Unilever who are experts at branding and marketing. It is refreshing to see these capsules at such reasonable value., they work out 15p each which is an absolute bargain. Even the dodgy imitation ones you find in sub prime supermarkets are more than these, and the great thing about Persil is that you can guarantee that the product is going to be high quality. These capsules come in a rubbery gossamer coated casing containing a different brightly coloured gel like liquids in each of the four compartments. And very funky they look too with purple, green, white and grey swirls of gu. These things wash your clothes nicely too and have a pleasant smell without being too overbearing. I have no idea what happens to the plasticated casing on the outside of the capsule after you put in in the washing machine. Maybe it bio-de-grades, maybe it disappears by magic, this is one of lives great mysteries like the Great Sphinx at Giza, the Bermuda Triangle or the meaning of the Voynich Manuscript.
Please wash really well and there is no residue left in the drum. Washing comes out clean and smelling fresh.

review_title: Stay dry all day and night
review_text: I have tried so many antiperspirants and all have let me down. LYNX is the only brand I can use that keeps me dry all day and night. I used to think that LYNX was just for teenagers and I had tried to move onto more expensive brands aimed at the mid-range male market, but they just didn't work as good as I had hoped. I have returned to LYNX and now I smell good and stay dry.
Brilliant product, lasts a long time but can buy it for £5 elsewhere.

review_title: What Happened to My Old Faithful?!?
review_text: I have used Vaseline on my lips for well over 20 years and loved it. I buy a large jar of plain Vaseline and use on my lips. I loved that there is really no smell or taste to it. BUT last week, I bought a new jar, put some on, and it has a taste that I can only explain of tasting like black oil that goes into a car. It is terrible! I2019ve tried using it for a week now, and just can2019t stand it any longer. I2019m guessing there2019s been a formula or ingredient supplier change? I hope you will bring back the old version. Very disappointed!

At first, I noticed I was getting some spots in places I don’t usually get them, but eventually they went away. However apart from that, I didn’t really notice any difference in my skin. It may have been a bit softer, but this difference was marginal. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

I'm such a fan of gel creams and this one is fantastic. Very smooth application and really hydrating. You wake up with the smoothest skin in the morning. Great new addition to my night time skin routine and very reasonably priced!

This is fantastic and does what it promises. I mix it with the moisturisers from the water boost range (the day and night time) and my skin has been sooo hydrated. No complaints. Great product and great price!
Amazing you get 3 for so little also works well and doesnt make hair sticky
Smells so nice like real sweet flowers! Also it's long lasting. Perfect combination.

review_title: Smells and applies well, but not strong enough
review_text: While this smelled lovely, and was very pleasant to apply, it lasted a morning before failing to protect.

Time after time I return to this product. While it is designed probably for younger skin I am in my 50's with menopausal skin which is sometimes irritated and find that this cream helps to calm down excema , redness etc. On its own it does not reduce the wrinkles and crepey skin that come with aging but when layered and used in conjunction with hyaluronic based creams that are water based it makes a wonderful companion and does a good job of making my eyes look reasonable and ironing out some of the wrinkles and loss of firmness. It is easily absorbed , doesn't leave greasy skin so is great under make up. Can be used with day or night eye creams. Best of all it's a good price.
lovely smooth soap,leaves the skin soft and clean!
As described

My vegan daughter persuaded me to buy this, I'm glad she did. A lovely creamy smooth ice cream. You'd never think it was non dairy. I'm not vegan myself, and I love ice cream, I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again.

review_title: WISH 100% JELLY CAME IN TUBE / LIP BALM
review_text: I love vaseline 100% jelly & have many jars (small tubs), cannot live without it & a loyal, long time customer however, wish the PURE 100% JELLY came in a convenient tube or lip balm to use on my lips. With the tubs you must use your finger. All the very small tubs and/or lip therapy, etc. come with an added color, flavor or something added besides 100% pure petroleum jelly which irritates my lips.Thank you for reading my concern & hopefully some day there will be \"pure vaseline\" in a lip balm / tube. Thank you.

Helped my scalp so much but the price is ridiculous when you consider the amount you have to use per wash and that you must buy the conditioner too. Any other non gentle brand would last me 4 times longer than this. It feels like people with illness are being rinsed (no pun intended). It's a no go for really long hair. I will be looking into other cheaper alternatives but the product is great. It's helped with my husbands dermatitis and with my sore scalp. At first my hair went dry and was like hay, then it was switching back and forth from dry to greasy but after a few weeks it's looking healthier than ever. I'm wondering if it just takes time for your hair to get used to less stuff on it and to get back to more of its natural form if you know what I mean.My main advice would be to try it for 6 weeks minimum before you write it off as rubbish.My only other annoyance aside from the price is that it's very thin and runny. It's hard to stop it running down my hair then off down my back so 20% of the bottle just goes down the plug hole without ever washing my hair first.
I've been using for some time - yes it may be gentle to the skin but it makes such a soggy mess in the soap dish unlike my old favourite, Lux. Had enough - planning to try to find something else.

I used to only every purchase Fairy non bio liquid as my husband suffers with eczema and is extremely sensitive. I would have never purchased anything else but my brother said try Persil non bio it’s great for my nephews sensitive skin. He gave me some of his and I randomly washed clothes and bedding in Persil, as I didn’t want my husband to say he had a flare down to the change. He didn’t, result for me because I love the fresh smell. I have also noticed and difference in the brightness of my whites and clothes are so soft. I live in a hard water area and the results are great. The capsules are so convenient and perform great with only one, because I am very heavy handed and fill the washing balls up, so I am also saving money with these. I am now a subscriber so don’t have to worry about running out :) I do wish they wasn’t so attractive on the eye because they do look edible. Please keep out of reach of children because the packaging isn’t child proof!!!

I'm nearly 26 so I said a year a go I must start using a night cream I have dry and sensitive skin I used the simple purifying cleansing lotion and soothing toner and light moisturiser there all amazing but the night is fantastic its moisturising and when I have spots it clears them up and makes my face look plump and takes my dryness away, It doesn't sting my eyes but the day cream does I think it's because of the SPF. Anyways really love this cream

review_title: Better Results After A Few Washes
review_text: Oddly enough this shampoo now performs much better than it did at the start. Not the most moisturising shampoo out there, my hair at first felt a little dry and stripped. However, not wanting to throw it out before I'd given it a good go, I persevered for a few more washes and now I'm glad I did. It leaves my hair soft and shiny, smooth and manageable and my scalp comfortable. It lathers and cleans well enough for my greasy roots without stripping the drier ends. Gives light moisture to hair without building up. It's grown on me and I now use it everyday!

Good fabric conditioner

I tried these as I’m fed up of powder and conditioner leaving a mess in the washing machine drawer and also taking up loads of space in the cupboards. We’d tried another brand however they weren’t perfumed and the other half likes his laundry to have a fragrance to it - personal preference. So I shopped around to find a cheap but known brand and found these in subscribe and save. We’re using them every few days and can say we are quite happy with them. They smell nice but not over powering, leave no residue in the drum or on clothes, come in refill packs so I can top up my container and then the bin isn’t full of powder boxes and they are easy to use as there’s no question over how much to use. Also as a plus, they don’t seem to bleach clothing as I found happened occasionally when using powder that got “stuck” in clothing and not rinsed out properly. If these stay at a good price then I will continue to buy as I’m very happy with them.

review_title: Still have these a few months on!
review_text: I like the facial wipes for exfoliation, but wouldn’t choose them for removing makeup. They have lasted me almost four months, and I still have a pack left.

Our household normally use comfort, however I hadn't used the 'Fresh Sky' scent before, which I must say is really nice! Just don't go sniffing directly from the bottle as it's concentrated, the scent is much more intense that it really is. The ultra concentrated allows for a much smaller bottle and you don't need to use as much in the washing machine either (just half a lid worth); the smaller bottle of course makes the carbon footprint smaller; in addition, the bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic which is a bonus, and both the bottle and lid can be recycled back. Only downside is the sleeve isn't, so do make sure you remove this before throwing the bottle in the recycling; hopefully they will work on making the whole thing recyclable in the future. All in all, good value for money and great scent (though the latter is subjective).

The fragrance is strong and the consistency of the conditioner is reasonably thick.I now use half as much as I previously used. One third to half a cap is quite enough for a full wash load to soften and produce amazing scent. And softens clothes admirably. We don't need an overpowering blast of perfume, a subtle whiff is lovely. By using less, we are doing our small bit to save the planet through pollution. We are also saving money as I've noticed that a bottle of softener lasts twice as long. Its a win win!

My wife has extremely sensitive skin, which I never believed until I inadvertently washed some of her clothing in a different detergent. On that basis, she has used either Persil or Fairy products for our joint laundry for many years. Combine that with the fact that we cannot use biological products as we have a septic tank, this product is ideal. The detergent is dispensed into a capsule which is inserted into the main body of the product and then placed on top of the laundry. There is sufficient detergent for 48 washes from the two bottles. The detergent is complimented by a fabric conditioner, which is measured out into the fabric compartment softener on the washing machine; there is sufficient to condition 24 washes. Both products have a pleasant "clean" fragrance and leave clothing smelling fresh and soft after drying. A really good product for those with sensitive skin and competitively priced against normal supermarket prices.

In this "kit" for sensitive skin you get x2 Persil non-biological washing detergent (potentially 48 washes) and x1 ultra-concentrate Comfort Pure (potentially 38 washes). I say potentially because if you are doing larger loads you'll need to increase the amount you use. We tend to alternate between Fairy and Persil non-bio, not only because we have young children but also because some family members have sensitive skin. We've never had an issue with someone having a reaction due to Persil, it's probably our preferred brand. We don't use Comfort Pure all the time because some members of the family don't like how it leaves their clothes feeling (too soft!), but we do use it on the children's clothes because it leaves them nice and soft. Both products in this kit are endorsed by the British Skin Foundation. Price for the kit at the time of writing the review is £11, this is slightly more than you would currently get the individual products in some supermarkets (£3 for each product). But you are getting them delivered too. If you wanted to give a practical baby shower gift, this would be ideal, slightly different to a nappy pyramid. Would also make a practical house-warming present. Overall - good products that work, slightly on the expensive side.

review_title: Love it, natural looking bronzed glow
review_text: Love this! I am fair haired, blue eyed, lily white skin older lady who burns to a crisp in the sun, when i uncover. Having just returned from holiday i wanted to at least look like i had a tan but it was very cold there. I bought this on offer and went for Fair - Med. The first time i put it on my arms all over sparingly i didnt really notice that much although there was definately something. Today i thought let me add a bit more after a my usual morning shower. I applied a bit more liberally over arms legs, and face. I have had comments today on what a lovely glow i have. It has developed nicely today. I have a sassy looking healthy bod and i feel good. Bought another tube and just ordered a few more whilst on offer. I hate sitting in the sun and burning (unless i am covered in P20 lotion) and this is a very safe way to get the bronze look. No streaks, easy to apply, doesnt stain hands, slight tan smell but not too much. I am hooked.

Really like the light colour this product gives me-easy to use & streak free. However, reading a lot of reviews many claim the lotion dries quickly however this is not my experience. I spend about an hour drying off and am sticky most of the day.

review_title: Follow the pouring instructions and you are on a winner!
review_text: Great fragrance that strikes just the right balance - although the wife complains that the small bottles are very difficult to pour accurately from. They probably are if you slurp in what you reckon is a full measure and, in fact, it is nearer two full measures. This is a really quick way to use up a small 540 ml bottle….but….if you use the cap as a measure as it is supposed to be…..then you will find it is a very economical way to use the conditioner! Very cool fragrance which actually carries through to your clothes, making you smell like a Fresh Sky – if you know what such a thing smells like? Something else I really like about this conditioner is that the bottles are all made from recyclable plastic and the manufacturer is asking for customers to recycle the new bottles so they can go the same path third time around! Three Stars for the product and another one for being good and green.

review_title: Economical, softens clothes, not as good as dedicated fragrancers if you want a lasting scent
review_text: Great price for these bottles, and you only need a small amount (half a cap) in the wash to soften clothes. The smell is nice but doesn't last - if you want something that lingers, try Lenor Unstoppables (but that won't soften clothes). That said, the softening effect is noticeable, even when handwashing delicate underwear. I like the ultra concentration which reduces the size of the bottles for storage.

This is an ultra concentrated fabric conditioner. I was initially surprised at how small the bottles were but then I read on the side that you only need half a cap of the product so each bottle will last you a while. It is nice to be able to fit the bottles in my kitchen cupboard! I did find that half a cap was enough. I live in an area with very hard water and my clothes came out of the wash feeling soft and smelling lovely. I did really like the scent although it is nothing special (it just had that generic floral fabric conditioner scent that they all have).

Bought one of the smaller sized bottles of the same softener to compare quality and was disappointed to find this was much thinner than the kind you find in the shop. Has been heavily diluted so no real saving, will be going back to getting it in the shop and cancelling my subscription.

review_title: Comfort Intense Laundry Conditioner Liquid (Fresh Sky)
review_text: Our household normally use comfort, however I hadn't used the 'Fresh Sky' scent before, which I must say is really nice! Just don't go sniffing directly from the bottle as it's concentrated, the scent is much more intense that it really is. The ultra concentrated allows for a much smaller bottle and you don't need to use as much in the washing machine either (just half a lid worth); the smaller bottle of course makes the carbon footprint smaller; in addition, the bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic which is a bonus, and both the bottle and lid can be recycled back. Only downside is the sleeve isn't, so do make sure you remove this before throwing the bottle in the recycling; hopefully they will work on making the whole thing recyclable in the future. All in all, good value for money and great scent (though the latter is subjective).
Lovely

This listing is for a pack of 8, concentrated fabric softeners, although I received a sample for review purposes. Note that the container is made from 100% recycled plastic and is suitable for further recycling, but you do need to remove the plastic wrap that holds the product information (once the bottle is used up, as you need it beforehand for dosing information). I found I needed to use a jar opener to remove the lid for the first time; I guess that is good when you are receiving this via the post as it means there is less chance of the lid coming loose and spilling contents into the parcel rather than onto your clothes. I like the scent, which transfers well to laundry and leaves it smelling floral without being overly sweet. It would be worth sniffing in a shop before committing to a large pack however, as not all laundry scents are to everyone’s taste. The softness is fantastic, particularly noticeable after laundry has been dried outside, which normally makes it feel stiff. A bottle will cover up to 36 loads (4-5 Kg), you will only manage 16 larger, 6-7 Kg loads. The bottle looks small, but the liquid is very concentrated, so do use the dosing cap rather than just pour into the machine as you will otherwise use too much (probably).

If I was a wild-eyed enthusiast and was asked to rate free Magnums as part of a promotion I'd perhaps err on the generous side. As a paying customer, however, these are nothing to write home about. There's an uncomfortable flavour clash, between the dark chocolate coating and the sickly sweet raspberry sauce which covers the core, that's difficult to describe. The core itself reminded me of the cheapest imaginable insipid, own brand raspberry ice-cream with little of the smooth creaminess you find in other Magnums. It's almost as if they rushed the product development process and ended up with bitter raspberry ripple on a stick. So, so disappointing when you consider what these could have been.

review_title: Not sure this is what the sky smells like? Very nice though.
review_text: This pack of 8 bottles of laundry conditioner is really nice. The scent is indeed what marketers would call 'fresh' it smells nice, but I'm not sure it's what the sky smells of... As ever with conditioner, a little goes a long way, but this is concentrated so you need way way less, you get 36 washes in a bottle, so there's a lot of savings straight off the bat vs normal conditioner. Very nice, good little bottles, would recommend them.

You know what you are going to get with Comfort regarding the feel and smell post wash. These Super concentrated fabric conditioners smell great use much less plastic (which is 100% from recycled sources so they say). You only need to use a fraction of the ammount of liquid of the non concentrated variety for the same results. Happy to say that all the claims on the product seem to be true so if you like that traditional Comfort smell buy with confidence.

I really like this - the scent is not overpowering and pleasant and it leaves clothes feeling softer. I particularly like the fact that the bottle is 100% recycled, and that there is a removable wrap around it so I can recycle again. review_title: Easy to pour as smaller, lighter bottles
review_text: Because the bottles are smaller and lighter, and I have a touch of stiffness in my hands I find these much easier to pick up and pour them than the traditional larger bottles, although I did have a bit of a struggle getting the lid off the first time. The scent is fresh, floral and pleasant, and not overpowering, and it lingers on washing well afterwards too. The bottles are reasonably good value as a little goes a long way - A half capful is recommended for washes of 4-5 kg, and a full capful for larger washes. There are 36 washes based on the half capful dose for 4-5kg loads, so as I usually do larger loads I should get approximately 18 washes per bottle. The bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic and it can be recycled again, except for the plastic sleeve.
Amazing value for money

These are 540ml bottles giving 36 wash loads of Fuchsia Passion fabric conditioner by Comfort. The bottles are entirely plastic, made from 100% recycled plastic and are 100% recyclable. The bottles have a narrow screw top, which is used as the measure, and the bottle has an accurate slim pourer – no dribbles. This one is concentrated and needs only ½ a capful for each washload. I've used Comfort on and off for many years and this Fuchsia Passion fragrance is a very nice, light floral fragrance. My towels and clothing all felt nice and soft after being washed and dried, and had a lovely smell of flowers with a hint of fruit – mango? – and freshly laundered clothing. It's not too strong or overpowering at all – just a nice smell of just washed clothes.

I got this on a deal for £9- amazing value for money, this pack has enough for 228 washes and a bottle for 60 washes is usually £5, so I basically saved £15?? I got this because my partner has sensitive skin and he's not had any issues, and it just smells Clean which is great!

Clearly this latest product variation from Comfort is to address some environmental concerns and plastics waste. The product is highly concentrated, so comes in a smaller bottle that is itself recycled. Reduced packaging and transport costs. All very commendable. Just how concentrated the product is can be sensed from the fact that you can detect the scent before you even open the bottle. When you do, don't breath deeply (as I did), it's overpowering. However, in it's more dilute form (just half a cap per load), it does add a pleasant, slightly zesty aroma to your clothes. The scent will be a matter of taste, but we like it and our washing feels soft and pleasant (though we were already regular Comfort users). In this form the product represents good value for a quality product and for those who want to lessen their impact on the environment (albeit in the smallest of ways), there's something for you here, too.

I usually use secret, which is the best by a country mile out of many, many anti perspirants I've tried over many years. Added this to my pantry order just to get free delivery but wow its rubbish. 8hrs after using and I start feeling wet and sticky under the arms and that's after a fairly sedentary day! Can't recommend at all, one of the worst I've tried. One star for the lovely smell though, even if its a little strong for me. Back to Secret for me!

review_title: Fabulous scent and lovely soft laundry.
review_text: I did a large amount of laundry yesterday and was immediately impressed with the scent of this fabric conditioner. Fuchsia Passion is delightful, such a lovely scent. As this is ultra concentrated you only need a little amount. I tumble dried most of the clothes and they came out soft and smelling lovely. I often find the tumble dryer makes laundry lose any scent but not on this occasion. I dried some clothes on a clothes horse and was delighted that the whole room took on a lovely scent. I am very impressed that Comfort have concentrated their fabric conditioner and are using recycled plastic in the bottle to cut the amount of plastics used. The whole bottle bar the wrapper is recyclable. The bottle is small (see picture) but as it is ultra concentrated it still lasts as long as a larger bottle. Highly recommended product.

review_title: Relied on for decades this is the best Non Bio
review_text: I have used this brand forever and love the way it never upsets any skin, especially when washing sheets and items that are next to the body such as jeans, underwear. Ever since I had small babies and now helping with grandchildren, this is the most child-friendly of all the branded washing products. Recommended by the Skin Foundation means you can try any eczema-afflicted skin with this item with confidence. Having the smaller, ultra concentrated Pure Comfort as an extra means you can dish up an extra helping of softness when required. Just a little amount will do the job. Altogether 48 washes from the two handy bottles of Persil's Non-Bio liquid detergent can be carefully measured into the bubble pod, so no waste. In our soft water area, the lesser amount can be used. Yes, it still sorts out everyday stains, no worries there. The scent is fresh and clean, the whole house smells lovely when the laundry is on the go, being aired and ironed.

review_title: It's a fabric conditioner not a game changer.
review_text: The hype attached to the scent of fabric conditioner is something as a family we ignore. All we want is for the clothes to smell fresh and pleasant after a wash, to be soft and comfortable to wear and for the product to be economical. Fortunately, this one fulfills all the criteria. When I say 'to smell fresh and pleasant' I don't mean stink the place out with the scent and overpower and wilt everything in a 100 yard radius. Again, fortunately, this doesn't do so and so gets a general thumbs up, but I could have done without the wording bigging up the wonderfulness of the smells. To me that's an alarm call not to purchase! I'll whisk myself away with my own favourite perfumes. I don't want my clothes having a big-smell life of their own!
Smells gorgeous even if I’ve dried them in the tumble. And great value for money if you do the subscription service.

review_title: Nice, gentle products that don't upset my family's eczema-prone skin
review_text: These are gentle, skin-kind versions within the Persil and Comfort ranges. The bundled pack is a practical suggestion that offers good value compared to the individual retail prices of 2x25 wash Persil and 1x38 wash Comfort, making the fabric softener effectively free. I can't remember not using Persil non-biological as my laundry detergent of choice, it's the brand I grew up with - one that doesn't irritate the eczema and allergy prone skin of several members of my family. It has a pleasant, but not overly dominant scent, and the fluid formulation means this can be used even on cold washes. The Comfort is a highly concentrated version in quite a small bottle. In real life, the bottle is rather smaller than the product photo makes it appear in relation to the Persil, but this doesn't represent poor value (38 washes worth is 38 washes worth regardless of the size container in which it comes) and the small size does a good job of keeping the use of packaging materials down.
good buy smells lush

review_title: I'm returning to the Persil non-bio fold.
review_text: I used Persil non-bio for many years, but changed to a brand specifically for babies about eight years ago, so it was a bit of a homecoming using it again. I really like the flip-top opening and how smoothly the product pours into the dispenser ball, which is much easier than the crosscut design on my usual brand that requires a fair amount of pressure. I never had a problem with how well Persil cleans, and this hasn’t changed; a machine load of baby clothes – together with stains - muslins and bedding came out spotless. With the addition of the Comfort Pure conditioner, the laundry was very soft and smelled lovely. It also performs well on general washing. I have decided to go back to using Persil non-bio; not just for the frustration-free dispenser, but it performs so well and is kind to skin. Using it again has made me wonder why I ever left the brand in the first place.

I regularly use Comfort intense conditioner - the Fuscia scented one is my favourite - i've tried the Fresh Sky one too which is nice but the Fuscia one is beautiful and the scent lasts a long time. I use this along with the matching Scent Pearls. Use half a capful of this along with your normal detergent then once dried you have this incredible dreamy scent that really lasts, you can smell it subtly when you open your wardrobe, it's lovely. This bumper box is a good way to buy in bulk or go to your supermaket and look out for special offers! Highly recommended, this is the best conditioner we've tried!

review_title: A good-value bundle for sensitive skin, featuring two bottles of Persil and one of Comfort
review_text: Although biological detergents are generally more effective than non-bio versions this version of Persil works well enough on babies wear and on normal soiling of the clothes of older people with sensitive skin. This handy pack includes two bottles of Persil non-bio liquid detergent (24 wash size) and one of Comfort Pure fabric conditioner (36 wash size) and is decent value at eleven pounds currently from Amazon. These two non-biological products are dermatologically tested and endorsed by the British Skin Foundation – they have been developed especially to be kind to sensitive baby skin. Good cleaning power for a non-biological washing detergent with soft and safe conditioning – well worth trying on your little one's clothes, or on your own if you have sensitive skin.
An excellent product which works amazingly.

At the current price, this works out at about 7.5p per wash, which considering the price of own label fabric conditioner is good value. Okay, you have to buy a box of it, but, if you have enough storage space, it's the way to go. It has a pleasant scent and it's a good size, though in this house we've been used to bigger bottles. The claim is it has 36 washes per bottle but that's using the recommended 1/2 cap, but I have to admit we've been using slightly more than that. Okay, that own label stuff will be cheaper and does come in a larger size but you do tend to have to use a bit more each wash.

Bulk buying this Intense version of this seems the only way to get true value for money unless you spot a deal. If you follow the on the bottle instructions the half a cap measure is enough to get the job done properly. The scent is lovely and really seems to last well even after some time after washing. Pleased overall just would probably get standard Comfort as a default and this as an on offer treat. Perhaps even better as the bigger bottles to get more for your money.

Try it on buttered toast, Mucky fat (Pork dripping with the brown jelly) on toast, in a sandwich with cheese, or sliced tomato or sliced boiled egg. Put it on your toast when having beans on toast, or add a couple of teaspoons to a mug of hot water for a tasty drink. Good in a stew or casserole or mixed with butter on a baked potato. It's definitely a love or hate thing....I love it and always take it on holiday if I think it won't be available wherever I'm going.

I was a bit worried that a product called 'Intense' might leave an overpowering scent on your laundry, who wants to walk around smelling of fabric conditioner? Thankfully it's not like that at all and the scent it leaves is fresh and quite subtle (once dry) and lingers around without being too pervasive. The Fresh Sky fragrance is appealing and not too chemical-like with a fruity/floral mix. For me, it suits household items more than clothes, things like towels and bed linen are left softened and fresh-smelling. I appreciate the small bottle size and concentrated liquid and that it has less environmental impact but I do think that the concentrated liquids are less effective at softening than the more dilute liquids are. If you're looking for the best softening then consider a full-sized bottle but if you prefer a more subtle softening effect but the same fresh fragrance then this concentrated version is a great buy.

review_title: Doesn't just soften and scent the wash, but the whole house smells fresh and clean!
review_text: I've not used a separate conditioner in years, because most washing products these days seem to do it all. I hadn't realised how much of a scent boost a separate fabric conditioner delivers, and how much it actually does soften the wash. The bottles - 6 of them, and not 8 as the ad states, come in a compact box and tbh, that itself could be used to deliver the products in, rather than having that placed in an Amazon box with more paper wrapping. All of the packaging, including the empty bottles, can be recycled. You don't waste any of the liquid, as the top of the bottle is well designed to minimise spillage and so that you can pour just what you need (half a capful is recommended, but I went with a little more), and not a gush of liquid from a large spout. I've had to dry indoors today due to the weather, and my whole house smells of this. I'm really impressed with this, and even for 6 bottles rather than the stated 8, this is good value for money. I also like that the small bottles mean that I can store them on a lower shelf for heavier items, rather than risking my under-sink shelving collapsing (yes, it's happened more than once!). Just don't squeeze the bottles hard, as they're made from recycled plastic and are a little flimsy-feeling.
Works well
Great value plenty of washes

This is a more traditional scent from fabric conditioning experts Comfort. This 8 pack is highly concentrated, so you don't need to place much in the conditioner tray for it to be effective. The bottle is made from recycled plastic and itself can be recycled. A nice set of 8 bottles.

Comfort Intense has a nice fresh fragrance, although don't use more than recommended as it can be quite strong. The bottle is a nice size, easy for storing in a cupboard and although it looks small, you get a lot of washes out of the bottle. It does leave fabrics softer and is good for using with stuff you wash regularly like towels. Highly recommended!

review_title: Brings comfort to your clothes and your soul
review_text: I love this product. It retains the quality one expects from the well known makers and leaves clothes feeling soft and smelling fresh. The concept of ultra concentrate isn't new as I recall they did one years ago in a tetra type pack. But now maybe public are ready for this innovation. The container is made from recycled plastic which is fantastic and refillable. It is also recyclable but the sleeve isn't which is a disappointment. I'm hoping the refill packs are from a more cardboard style pack though and fully recyclable. I'm glad it has a dose counter as it seems so much less to use it would be easy to put in too much if it wasn't there. My other half and I have sensitive skin and this was fine for us to use. I found it hard to read the small print on the wrapper even with magnification glass. But I couldn't see anything to say if it was tested on animals or if any animal products used in the making. Although this is not a food product these are issues that are important for many. Whilst it provides details of the headquarter offices it doesn't actually say where its produced, I think this would be helpful to know as for many people myself included would prefer to buy products made in country of sale to reduce carbon footprint. I am a little torn about this product as if it was a washing powder or liquid and comfort softener combination I can't help thinking that cuts down packaging and carbon footprint further and can be better value. However separate comfort softener such as this does make clothes smell lovely.
Washing my clothes

This is a multi-pack of eight bottles of fabric softener. They are not the typical large sized bottles that I am used to, which is a bonus as they are cumbersome and tricky to store. These are half the height and fit better in the storage area in my kitchen. The softener itself has a strong, but not overpowering floral smell. Clothes come out of the wash noticeably softer after use, when compared without any. As I line dry my washing, this has been a nice addition to my laundry routine.
All my family have sensitive skin and perfume based softeners cause havoc with the skin and this product works brill with big and small babies alike!
Good

review_title: Comfort Intense Laundry Conditioner Liquid: Fresh Sky 540 ml.
review_text: I'm used to using the standard Comfort fabric conditioner as it's a brand I buy regularly; this concentrated version is quite impressive – with only a 15ml measure required for my modest laundry load it is economical and just as effective as the standard product. The scent is pleasant and lasting. I haven`t checked around widely for prices, but this 8 bottle pack currently works out cheaper than my local supermarket for the same product. Very happy with the results.

review_title: Seems to work well regarding softness, but not much scent.
review_text: LIKES - Lots of softness. The washed clothing seems remarkably pleasant to touch and feel. - The specified quantity per wash is smaller than some other conditioners, meaning that a smaller bottle gives plenty of washes. LESS LIKED - Seems to have a rather 'light' scent, when used at the advised quantities, so if you like the scent of fabric conditioners you will get less of it. CONCLUSION A decent product, which seems to work well - recommended.

review_title: Perfect for eczema and sensitive skin
review_text: We use Persin non-bio washing liquid all the time. It is by far the best washing liquid for sensitive skin. I suffer from eczema and have tried all sorts of sensitive skin washing liquids / powder but Persil is without a doubt the best. Comfort adds a little bit of softens to the whole mix and makes the clothes softer thus easier to wear / removing the little bit of stiffness that can irritate very sensitive skin.

It's very rich so a little goes alobg way, especially on hot summer nights. There's no fragrance and the ingredients are fab for anyone, not just mature skin

I have been using this scrub for years now and I don't know of any other that comes close. Price is fab. I only have to use this scrub once a week, as it is so good, don't need to do it more than once. I have sensitive skin and have never had a problem. As long as its on the shelf, I'll keep buying it. Im a Coeliac and intolerant to cows milk, and have a huge sweet tooth. Ive found some amazing vegan ice cream alternatives. Ocado sell a number of delicious ones. I also LOVE Tescos gluten and dairy free Cornettos However was super excited to try these, especially after all the amazing reviews. The tops are covered in nuts and chocolate, and the cone is thick and crispy. However none of these bits are quite enough to hide the awful taste of the ice cream. I cant even describe it as bland, as it had a flavour.... just an awful one. It was not creamy and ice cream like. It was like frozen whipped up soya milk that they removed the flavour from. I enjoyed eating the chocolate and nut part and the cone, and just cringed my way through the ice cream part. Cant understand all the rave reviews. The vegan Magnums however are spot on and delicious!!!

review_title: Not as good as the ultra duo
review_text: Very dissapointed in these capsules. The previous version, which was the Ultra, with only two compartments, was great because the capsules dissolved completely without leaving traces. These leave small white trails on dark clothes.

review_title: It's no cookies and cream but a welcome yum treat
review_text: I was so excited to purchase this as I react to the usual dairy brands. The cone is lovely and the ice cream is nice enough to feel you are having a treat. It doesn't have the creamy feeling and texture of ice cream but near enough to eat and enjoy without any reaction! It's a little smaller than the full size cornetto but that's ok to keep the calories down. Would have liked the choc lump at the bottom of the cone. Already ordered my second box.
